alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Houston; Humphreys; Montgomery (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 09 at 3:52PM CST until December 09 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Dickson County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Montgomery County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Houston County in Middle Tennessee... Cheatham County in Middle Tennessee... Eastern Humphreys County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 445 PM CST. * At 352 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near McEwen, or 8 miles southeast of Waverly, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Dickson, Ashland City, Waverly, White Bluff, Kingston Springs, Pegram, McEwen, Burns, Charlotte, Vanleer, Slayden, and Cheatham Dam. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 159 and 160, between mile markers 164 and 181, and between mile markers 185 and 191. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 3. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.
